result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald Jones Jr.

records.addlTxt:
10:08 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Gerald Jones Jr. in court.  Attorney Christopher William Rose in court for Gerald Jones Jr. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Rose is requesting an adjournment as an offer was extended from the State last week and he needs additional time to discuss the offer with the DE. The State does not object. Court adjourns.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant, Gerald Jones, appeared with Attorney Christopher William Rose.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 08:45 am.

102PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Chris Rose.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on July 28, 2022 at 08:45 am. before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  Bond continued as previously set.   ts
from the court re: Judicial Rotation

Defendant Gerald Jones in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
   *No Weapons, especially firearms. No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Kiesha C-H, Trinati C-K.

01:15 PM   Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:45 am.. DE is on a Probation Hold. $2500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). State moves to dismiss penalty enhancer in Count #1.  Court dismisses enhancer.  rb
and witness list filed by the State
